headline: Shale Is Plateauing. Oil Only Has One Place Left to Grow.
summary: Shale drilling’s hot growth turned the U.S. into the world’s largest oil producer over the last decade.  Offshore drilling in the U.S. got a bad reputation after the 2010 explosion of  BP Deepwater Horizon oil rig, which spilled 4 million barrels of oil into the Gulf of Mexico.  Investment in offshore has seen a resurgence and it could become much larger in the future, depending on oil prices and future demand.
